title: Perception in Active Inference
description: Perception in Active Inference is the process of inferring hidden states of the world from sensory observations by minimizing variational free energy.
learning_objectives: Understand perception as Bayesian belief updating
Explain the role of generative models in perception
Connect perception to variational free energy minimization
Apply perceptual inference to simple examples

content.overview: In Active Inference, perception is the process of inferring the hidden causes of sensory data. It involves updating beliefs about the world state to best explain observations, formalized as minimizing variational free energy between the generative model and sensory data.

perception_as_inference.bayesian_brain: The brain as a Bayesian inference machine

mathematical_formulation.perception_goal: Minimize free energy over recognition density Q(s)
mathematical_formulation.evidence_lower_bound: ELBO = -F provides lower bound on log-evidence

generative_model_role.likelihood: P(o|s) - how observations depend on states

perception_action_cycle.update: Revise beliefs to minimize prediction error
